com.codemelon.graph.algorithm.search

Class DepthFirstSearch<T extends DfsVertex>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.codemelon.graph.algorithm.search.DepthFirstSearch<T>

  • public class DepthFirstSearch<T extends DfsVertex>
extends java.lang.Object
    Implementation of depth-first search following CLRS, p. 604. The graph to be searched may be directed or undirected.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int FIRST_DISCOVERY_TIME
      The discovery time shown for the vertex first visited in the search

    • Constructor Summary

        public static final int FIRST_DISCOVERY_TIME
        The discovery time shown for the vertex first visited in the search
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • DepthFirstSearch

        public DepthFirstSearch(AbstractGraph<T> graph)
        Prepare the depth-first search. No changes are made to the graph when it is passed into the constructor.
        Parameters:
        graph - graph on which the search will be run

    • Method Detail

      • search

        public boolean search()
        Conduct a depth-first search on the graph, visiting vertices in no predetermined order. This method modifies the graph in the following ways:
        1. All vertices will be colored black after this method call.
        2. All vertices will have discoveryTime and finishTime set according to the order in which they were first discovered and finished. The first discovery time will be 0.
        3. Vertices will have parent fields set as determined by the search.
        4. Edges will be classified as TREE, BACK, FORWARD or CROSS
        The search() method returns a boolean value which is true iff the graph is acyclic.
        Returns:
        true iff the graph is acyclic.
